message: Hi Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll really like. I'm willing to let it go for $95. Is that something you'd be interested in?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate the product you're offering. I would like to propose a price of $85 for the product.
I appreciate your offer, Bob, but I was thinking more along the lines of $92. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit on this sale. What do you think?
I understand your position, Alice. How about we settle on $88 for the product?
I appreciate your persistence, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $90, but I'm not willing to go any lower. This is my final offer on the product.
Considering the value of the product to me, I believe $87 would be a fair price for us both.

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm starting to think we're getting close to the minimum price I'm willing to accept. I'm willing to meet you at $89, but that's as low as I can go.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice. Considering the value of the product, I would like to propose a price of $88.

I think we've been here before, Bob. I'm not willing to go back and forth on the same price. I'm sticking with my previous counteroffer of $88. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'm going to have to consider other options.
